title: Whole30 Chicken Fajita Bowls (No Rice)
description: Bright, smoky chicken fajita bowls packed with seared bell peppers, onions, avocado, and a tangy lime-cilantro dressing. Quick skillet cooking yields caramelized vegetables and juicy spiced chicken for a satisfying Whole30-friendly meal without rice.

ingredients.display_name: boneless skinless chicken breasts, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch strips
ingredients.notes: slice across the grain into even strips
divided use for chicken and vegetables

ingredients.display_name: red bell pepper, seeded and sliced into 1/4-inch strips
ingredients.notes: or substitute with extra orange pepper

ingredients.display_name: yellow bell pepper, seeded and sliced into 1/4-inch strips
large onion, thinly sliced (preferably sweet or yellow)
romaine lettuce, chopped (base instead of rice)

ingredients.notes: slice just before serving to prevent browning

ingredients.display_name: red pepper flakes (optional for extra heat)

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: trim and slice chicken into uniform strips, core and slice peppers, thinly slice onion, chop cilantro, juice limes, mince garlic, chop lettuce and dice tomato if using.
Make the fajita seasoning: mix cumin, paprika, chili powder, half the salt and half the pepper in a small bowl.
Toss chicken with 1 tablespoon olive oil, minced garlic, and the prepared fajita seasoning until evenly coated; set aside to marinate briefly.

Heat a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat until hot, add 1 tablespoon oil, then add the chicken in a single layer; sear without moving for 2 minutes to develop color, then stir and continue cooking until just cooked through and juices run clear.
Transfer cooked chicken to a plate and tent loosely with foil to rest while you cook the vegetables.

Return skillet to medium-high heat, add remaining 1 tablespoon oil, add sliced onions and peppers and the remaining salt and pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and caramelized at edges.
Add chicken back to skillet with vegetables and toss to combine and reheat for a minute; adjust seasoning if necessary.
Make lime-cilantro dressing: whisk together lime juice, chopped cilantro, remaining minced garlic, a pinch of salt, and optional red pepper flakes; taste and adjust acidity or salt.

Assemble bowls: divide chopped romaine among bowls as the base, top with avocado slices, a portion of chicken and pepper mixture, diced tomato if using, and drizzle with lime-cilantro dressing; garnish with extra cilantro and a lime wedge.
